intro: Notoseris gracilipes, commonly known as the slender leaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and has small, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, elongated seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Notoseris gracilipes is often found in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands.
